section.title: Why Not Markdown?

blockquote.simpara: Markdown is intended to be as easy-to-read and easy-to-write as is feasible.
Markdown’s syntax is intended for one purpose: to be used as a format for writing for the web.
Markdown is not a replacement for HTML, or even close to it. Its syntax is very small, corresponding only to a very small subset of HTML tags.

The idea for Markdown is to make it easy to read, write, and edit prose. HTML is a publishing format; Markdown is a writing format. Thus, Markdown's formatting syntax only addresses issues that can be conveyed in plain text.
For any markup that is not covered by Markdown’s syntax, you simply use HTML itself.

section.para: In summary, if you're looking to do something more than write prose, Markdown might not be the tool for you. If you're not targeting HTML (or you're targeting more than just HTML like man pages) then Markdown might not be the right tool for you.
